title: Lowest Electricity Production from Renewable Sources
description: In 2021, Equatorial Guinea had the lowest electricity production from renewable sources, excluding hydroelectric, at -23.72% of the total energy production.

title: Highest Increase in Methane Emissions
description: Methane emissions in Equatorial Guinea increased by 2942.83% from 1990 to 2023, marking the highest growth rate globally.

title: Highest Increase in Total Greenhouse Gas Emissions
description: From 1990 to 2023, total greenhouse gas emissions in Equatorial Guinea rose by 3674.11%, the highest increase worldwide.

title: Highest Bank Nonperforming Loans Ratio
description: In 2022, Equatorial Guinea had the highest ratio of nonperforming loans to total gross loans at 55.41%.

title: Lowest Bank Capital to Assets Ratio
description: Equatorial Guinea had the lowest bank capital to assets ratio globally in 2022, at just 1.15%.

title: Lowest Growth in Claims on Private Sector
description: In 2023, claims on the private sector in Equatorial Guinea decreased by 25.95% as a percentage of broad money, the lowest growth rate worldwide.

title: Lowest Primary Completion Rate for Males
description: In 2015, only 37.44% of males in Equatorial Guinea completed primary education, the lowest rate globally.

title: Lowest Gross Intake Ratio in Primary Education
description: The gross intake ratio for first grade of primary education in Equatorial Guinea was 62.30% in 2015, the lowest globally.

title: Highest Percentage of Children Out of School (Male)
description: In 2015, 62.33% of male children of primary school age were out of school in Equatorial Guinea, the highest percentage worldwide.

title: Lowest Percentage of Trained Teachers in Lower Secondary Education
description: In 2015, only 11.19% of teachers in lower secondary education were trained in Equatorial Guinea, the lowest percentage globally.

title: Lowest Voice and Accountability Rank
description: Equatorial Guinea ranked at the lowest percentile for voice and accountability in 2022, with a percentile rank lower bound of 0.48%.
